DataElement.preferredDefinition: yes/no indicator related to the removal or excision by surgical measures of an organ located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the removal or excision by surgical measures of an organ located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:(ree-SEK-shun) Removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

Concepts.definition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

Property.preferredDefinition: The organ located between the esophagus and the small intestine where digestion of food occurs before passing to the small intestine.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The primary organ of food digestion. It is located under the diaphragm, between the liver and the spleen as well as between the esophagus and the small intestine.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ACOSOG CRF:American College of Surgeons Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
